website_summaries.verdict: Bluetooth earphones don't get much more affordable than the Skullcandy Jib Wireless, which packs a strong bass punch for the price.
pros: Powerful bass response matched with sculpted highs
cons: Not for purists seeking accurate frequency response

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great; occasionally have to re-pair with device
customer_reviews.text: PROS: I use these daily. They're working as well today as they did the day they arrived. Skullcandy earbuds are my favorite, as they have great sound quality. CONS: Occasionally I have to re-pair them with my phone... not sure why, haven't figured out the rhyme or reason, and that's annoying, but it doesn't happen too often. Would have liked them to come with a carrying case. Found and ordered one separately that they fit in. Overall, I'm happy with the earbuds. They're my go-to for sound.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: We both love them. I can leave my phone and walk ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for myself and my daughter. We both love them. I can leave my phone and walk almost all the way through my house without losing the connection. Love that they have two sizes to adjust for smaller ear canals. Ironically, the normal size fit my daughter great but I had to use the smaller ones. Apple pods always hurt my ears and this is my second Skullcandy pair - great fit (first pair are wired and still working years later). Happy I went with Skullcandy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Curran

customer_reviews.title: "Power Off" feature is super annoying
customer_reviews.text: These are OK. The sound is fine, the charge lasts a while. The biggest problem is that it goes off by saying "power off" in your ear at random times that make absolutely no sense. In one case, they turned themselves off in the first 30 min of me turning them on after a full 24 hour charge. I would be less frustrated if their website actually helped you understand why this happens but there is next to no information on the skullcandy site. I attend 9- 10 hours of conference calls a day and if these continue to shut off randomly, not sure I'll be a big fan and may have to scrap them.
customer_reviews.author: C-Wiz

customer_reviews.title: Great starter wireless ear buds for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but I have a few issues with it. It'll unpair with my phone if it's far away from it for a while and I have to re do the process, though fast a bit annoying. Sometimes they slide off my neck and i have dropped them a few times so yyou have to watch out for that. Another thing is if you put it in your pocket it'll turn itself on sometimes and you don't know it which obviously kills the battery but if you pay attention these things I have no huge issues with them. They're my first pair of wireless headphones and I think they're good to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Megh Smith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I get MAYBE two hours out of these on a full charge. Can’t even make it to work and back without the battery dying. Have to plug it in at work. The max volume is really low, too. I like bass and loud volume and these earbuds have neither. Really disappointed because i’ve always been a skull candy fan. It randomly comes disconnected and seems to “drop” signal, resulting in what sounds like song skipping. Which I haven’t heard since I got rid of my Walkman. I guess you can’t go cheap on Bluetooth earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: G. Willikers

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage. Battery life downright sucks. I get maybe 1/3 of the battery life compared to similarly sized earphones from other manufacturers. They have a very hard time connecting to my iphone. The cord is weirdly long and the dongle in the middle bounces around if you aren't sitting still. It ends up pulling the earphones out of your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive lightweight headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a spare headset — this is a good choice. Sure it has some negatives but the price is right. Positives + it’s small— EarPods about a size of a penny. + one of the most cost effective Bluetooth earphones from a known brand + ok sound quality especially for the price + mic seems to work well and no complaints Negatives * battery size is pretty large for the battery life but good enough for conference calls and light music * really really light and small so it’s easy to lose * doesn’t always connect with Bluetooth the first time
customer_reviews.author: Techguru

customer_reviews.title: Decent little buds
customer_reviews.text: These sound decent enough for the gym. They do much for active noise canceling, but they aren't exactly high dollar cans either. They seem to have a problem with going into pairing mode when I turn them on instead of connecting to my phone, which they should already be paired with. If I could get them for under a 10 spot, I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to listen to music and podcasts while playing games, cleaning, and working on my laptop at home. The noise cancellation is great, as is the sound quality. I have had no issues connecting my phone and laptop to it and am left free to wander the house, even upstairs while my phone charges on the first floor, without losing connection. I have not timed how long the battery lasts but it is certainly several hours. I have no complaints about the battery life because I don't need it to last all day and can easily charge it before bed or while I'm doing something I don't need them for.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Walters

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: All earbuds fall out of my ears and some both hurt to wear and fall out. These only fall out but not quite as bad as others and they don't hurt. I felt having them tethered would at least prevent my losing half a pair & that has not happened. I am a bit disappointed that they only give 6 hours on a charge but if I was still working I couldn't listen more than 6 hrs a day. I'm retired now and listen to more podcasts and audio books and these suit me well but run out on me. Having 2 took care of that, one charging while the other in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mothermersnerd

customer_reviews.title: They don’t work/ hold charge
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with skull candy. I always used to buy their wired JIB products in store and I wanted to try out their wireless line of this product since I had been using another brand that lacked some bass. I used the earphones only once, and recharged them for a second use. On that use it only lasted 10 mins or so. After that I charged it once again and it doesn’t even turn on. Ruined my workout (I used these in a gym). I didn’t think these would last forever at this price point. But they didn’t even last over a day..
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, bad charger
customer_reviews.text: **update** I’ve had them a while now and something SUPER annoying: if I pause my music and watch a video or scroll through another site, they don’t actually disconnect, but there’s no sound when I try to turn my music back on. I then have to disconnect and connect again. Love em, except that the charger is extremely temperamental. If it’s not in EXACTLY the right spot, no charge. And it’s especially fun when the charger gets a bit of air on it so it disconnects. Great sound, not bad battery life (when it actually charges), and super easy to pair with an iPhone (probably Android, as well). It’s just that stupid 2 inch charger...
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, tiny pairing issue
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They are lightweight and battery life is good. The sound quality is amazing for the price. I like these much better than a previous more expensive pair of bluetooth headphones I had. The only issue I have had is that every few days they unpair from my phone and I have to go in and re-pair them. It only takes a few seconds to go back into my settings and re-pair them, but it is fairly annoying to have to do it basically after every 3 uses. I would have given five stars without the pairing issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn A Wearden

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good wireless earbuds for the price, especially if you don't trust yourself to have ones that aren't connected together somehow. Has a little voice that lets you know the connection and battery status of the earbuds. The colors are pretty cool. Downsides are that the latency on YouTube is not great. It's only by a second, but the delay is noticeable. Sometimes they will hiccup and the audio will fade out slightly and then fade back in to normal volume.
customer_reviews.author: Silvystar

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy Earbuds Are The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 pairs of Skullcandy earbuds now. These are my first Bluetooth pair. They fit in my ears perfectly and are never at risk of falling out. I like to wear them towards my chest instead of towards my back. The charging piece of the headphones is the heaviest part and can fit awkwardly around the back of your neck. Have used these outdoors running or biking, indoors on a treadmill, stationary bike, or weight lifting. They're great. Buy 2. I'm about to buy a second pair for my wife. Battery life is fine. Maybe 2 working days, ~12 - 16 hours of use before they need to be charged.
customer_reviews.author: John Kettering

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Stopped while in use, and would not reconnect. I unpaired it hoping to pair it back up, and now it will not pair. I've never been disappointed with any of the wired earbud mics from Skullcandy before, so I have no idea how they could've screwed the proverbial pooch this badly. But I've never had good luck with this type of device, so maybe it's just the tech. Either way, get a wired set, and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry H.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for being great for small ears!
customer_reviews.text: These are a rare find for people who sleep in headphones. I sleep in earbuds and have tiny ears. These are the lowest profile blue tooth earbuds I've found for under $50. If you put extra small tips on them they will suite even the tiniest ears and I can lay down on them without discomfort. The battery life isn't awesome, but when my phone stops playing audio, these also seem to stop running their battery down, so it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Lockness

customer_reviews.title: Good for the PRICE
customer_reviews.text: These would have gotten a 5 star rating, however...the ONLY complaint is that they "automatically" shut off when NOT used consistently! So it is a PAIN to turn them on/pair again if you want to use them. It would be GREAT if they would stay ON until you turned them off. Also, they do not vibrate to notify you a call or text has come in, therefore not helpful IF you don't have your phone right in front of you. But for the PRICE, this is as good as you can get!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a cheap replica
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds aince I’ve own them before and they worked amazing until i broke them. So i ordered these after experimenting with other type. First off, this feel so cheap. The button makes a rattling noise like the cheap headphones you buy at the gas station. Second battery life lasts up to 2 hours even if i had them charging for the whole night. I also hate that i lose connection a lot even if MY PHONE IS IN MY BACK POCKET. So frustrating. A waste of my money. Definitely not Skullcandy quality
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: cuts out about 20 minutes into a call
customer_reviews.text: I love it for music but when I am on a call or video conference it disconnects itself after about 20 minutes which is really annoying and inconvenient. I even made sure that nothing else was connected or remembered on my bluetooth to make sure that it wasn't interference. Nope, it turns itself off every time. The only reason I am giving it 2 stars instead of 1 is because it does work with music.
customer_reviews.author: sworrel

customer_reviews.title: Sounds goes in and out when paired with MacBook
customer_reviews.text: I needed headphones with a microphone to work from home and thought i would get a bluetooth enabled pair to work with my laptop and my phone, which have different ports. The headphones work ok with my phone, but i primarily need them to work with my computer. When paired with my computer, the sounds goes in and out. I've tried every fix for it and the problem persists. The port on the cord also creates a very distracting amount of noise in your headphones when it brushes against your shirt or hair. I wish i had done more research before ordering. I would recommend spending more on a higher quality pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: MLanterman

customer_reviews.title: Best buds for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are the best Bluetooth earbuds on Amazon right now in my opinion. Battery life is pretty reasonable. Sound is what I expect from Skullcandy, in others words the sound quality is great! These are exactly what I was looking for since my phone was designed without an earphone jack. Stupid design by Apple. Maybe if Skullcandy put “Designed in California” on their products, consumers would be more accepting of their shortcomings. That’s what Apple does and it’s worked great for them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Early

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Battery does not last it dies very quickly. Wouldn't buy ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bud for a cheap brand
customer_reviews.text: Skull candies are my go to for a cheaper earbud. If you take care of them they should last a year or two. They're not going to last long term by any means though you shouldn't expect them too but if you need em in the short term or as a quick replacement they're great. Sound quality is excellent and the noise cancelling is great. The wired ones are great too. I use these at work every day.
customer_reviews.author: Bookish

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Pairing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Skullcandy Jib Bluetooth Wireless In-Ear Earbuds with microphone in red. To use for phone pairing, I found the battery dies within 30 minutes. I started using it at the gym and it lasted much longer. But once the battery died and I recharged it, I couldn't get it to pair anymore with my iPhone 8 or my iTouch. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Product was decent quality for the price. At least at first... After about two weeks of use, one of the ear buds stopped working. So I could only listen to music in one ear. I don’t know if I just got a dud or if this is a common problem with this product. However, I’ll likely not be purchasing earbuds from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Davis

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend getting the ones for 50 bucks from skullcandy b/c ...
customer_reviews.text: It is ok. I definitely recommend getting the ones for 50 bucks from skullcandy b/c it has a neckband which stays in place. This one has a small black receiver or battery in the middle of the wires that hangs weridly in the back so when you try and turn your head left or right it pulls out of your ear. Not cool if your running or riding a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's an okay headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Well for starters, this headphone is very lightweight which is a positive for me. But the fitting of the buds is a little weird to me but still okay. However, when listening to music it sounds cheap and the bass isn't really strong. Even when I try to call my friends or family with this, they always say the same thing, they cannot hear me as I sound very muffled. Overall, it's an okay product, but it's not recommended for people who want a strong bass or to use it for phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissianey

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: 2019 addendum-- I haven't used this in ages, but put it back in to my rotation. I turned it on around 9am today and it shut off on its own 4 times. I downgraded my rating to 1* It also moves around constantly because there is no neckband to keep it somewhat balanced. Original Even though I keep the phone on me, there considerable distortion of the sound. Battery life seemed worse than others I have.
customer_reviews.author: Meher

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and quality of the product. Noise cancellation was surprisingly good, and sound quality is great. I've been disappointed with the battery life of other wireless earphones, but these last long enough for a good workout and wind-down, and then some. My only complaint is that the battery component is the heaviest part of the unit, and it weighs the earphones down. So sometimes when I am moving a lot during yoga, an earbud might occasionally fall out; this may be due to my small ear size being a non-perfect fit for the buds, but regardless, I'm not a fan of how bulky the battery part is. Overall 9/10, worth the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but dead after a  few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I love Skull Candy for their sound and price range, but this is the second pair of these that I've had that have died after a few weeks. Dead as in will not charge or turn on at all. It's disappointing because they are perfect for what I use them for, but I don't want to buy another pair just to have them crap out again. I would not recommend purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Very great sound.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had this product for a few months now and it has come in handy. I never wear it to workouts due to reviews but it's great for early morning commutes and hikes. Love the sound(even though it may not be real loud) It loud enough for me. And I hope it lasts me another few months or hopefully a year or two. I recommend Skullcandy. Edit- So I have not lost these headphones for the past 2 years(Lucky). And all I could say is that they are reliable or the batch I got was great. Thinking of buying different skullcandy headphones next. 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding, but slightly disappointing battery
customer_reviews.text: I'll get this out of the way first. Battery life is sub par. I can get about 5 hours out of her before she quits. Meanwhile I've got coworkers who will wear theres an entire shift and have no issues. But, I definitely feel these are more comfortable and definitely better sounding then the brands they're wearing. I believe it's worth the shortish battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Pitchford

customer_reviews.title: This battery is bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little surprised by the size of the battery. It is big and moves around, pulling on the earbud. When wearing the ear buds I like free movement - being able to turn my head without the earbud cord getting caught or being restricted. The problem with the battery is that if you are moving around, it shifts to one side or the other, pulling on the opposite earbud. You can try to re-position the battery into the center of the back of your neck, but again, if you are moving around, the weighty battery shifts. Not recommended if you like to wear the buds while you are moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Angus Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty decent. My main complaint is that I only use one earbud at a time since I wear them at work and due to not having the weigh down the other one constantly ends up on the other side of my head. But sound is decent and so is the battery. I can get probably about 3 hours on a full charge maybe a little more before I have to charge again.
customer_reviews.author: The PeanutTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bluetooth wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I had one and misplaced it so I ordered another one. I really love these earbuds because they are easy to use and work great. I like the wireless earbuds that still are connected to each other. God knows if I had the ones that don't connect together, I would lose them. These earbuds are great, I can't say that enough.
customer_reviews.author: Reyna Austria

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I usually use beats by Dre wireless Powerbeats but I bought these for my mother who is not technology savvy just to make calls they are the worse I’ve ever heard in my life. I loved skull candy in the wired earphone fats but these sound horrible and broke on day three. Sorry mom. I’ll spend more and buy you something else. Don’t buy you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard j.

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connection on this one is intermittent.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several of these. I tend to lose small electronics so I don't like to spend much. Seems like the more I spend the faster I lose it. I bought the 1st one of these a year ago and this one was probably my 4th or 5th. But it drops in and out of Bluetooth connectivity intermittently. I've never been super impressed with the sound quality or noise cancellation. They don't work for calls in most spaces... people tell me they can't hear me. But they are ok for a pair of inexpensive headsets that you won't beat yourself up about losing.
customer_reviews.author: daniel a german

customer_reviews.title: A great bargain
customer_reviews.text: It is very simple to use. Pairing and connecting is very easy. The sound is great. It is quite basic, the controls are very limited and you cannot control volume on the device. All things considered, the sound is equal or better than my LG. The sound is as good as my Altec Lansings and so much more reliable. A real bargain as far as I'm concerned. The biggest drawback is the poor manual.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always liked Skullcandy and this pair is not bad for the price. Been looking for a pair that works with my Apple Watch and this by far has not had any issue connecting to my watch which I’m very grateful. But overall the quality is only average. Update: Very easy to pair with any devices, but running with it is not very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this was only 10$ when I got it so I don't have much complaints the speakers sound great. I saw other comments about not staying charged for 6hrs I can't comment on that as I haven't used it for that long but it seems to stay charged for 3+hrs just fine. Bluetooth works good over all I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: j woff

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve actually gone through two sets of these, the dog decided to eat the first set. But they were definitely worth a repurchase. Easy to pair with more than one device, sound quality is nice and does block out other sounds fairly well. Only complaint is I have very small ears and even the smallest rubber pieces still make my ears hurt after a few hours. I chose purple if it matters.
customer_reviews.author: Bumby

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a nice pair of wireless headphones that were inexpensive...I got what I asked for. The sound quality and battery life is good and they are comfortable in my ears. I do wish the battery pack was not this large dumb looking thing handing from the cord, but my hair is long enough to cover it, so I can overlook that. Otherwise, I got what I paid for and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Of course the sound is amazing! And I can say the noise cancellation is really good. I’m just a bit disappointed with the battery life, it says that will last at least 8 hours and in my experience is between 4 and 5, the worse is that I’m in the gym and they give you the notification of low battery just 15 minutes before they turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Just as annoying as wired headphones. Weight position not good
customer_reviews.text: The position of the weight is horrible. The reason I went with wireless headphones was to not get frustrated with wires caught on things, especially while working out. The moment you bend over with that buds and the weight falls to either side of your head it tugs on the opposite side ear bud. It's really annoying. Definetly get the newer model with weights on both sides. Otherwise sound quality is great for the money, I've always been a fan of skull candy value ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome for the price. I do have a similar (or same) model but I think it used to have a little thing to dustproof the charging port (my aunty took it so I don't recall perfectly). Overall I do feel that its a little bit less quality than the one I bought previously although they are the same model? Any way. good buy for 9.99
customer_reviews.author: SBM

customer_reviews.title: They’re Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, decent battery life, comfortable, affordable. Everything that makes these an awesome pair of earphones. Grab them while they’re on sale though they are a bit pricey. Not as loud as I’d like them to be but I paid 15$ I can’t complain. Pretty good pair of earbuds, kinda weird style but I don’t have any issues with it being uncomfortable. Bottom line I’d recommend them to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Atencio

customer_reviews.title: No volume control
customer_reviews.text: I love these wireless headsets. They're PERFECT fpr the gym, as I no longer have to worry about the wire getting caught while running. The only dislike is the lack of volume control. The volume is controlled by the device, but other than that small issue- perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Rollison Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Battery will not last long (maybe 3 hours tops?) so you will be needing to charge it often. It does have great sound quality for those using for casual purposes such as jogging or house activities. The one other drawback is that the back of the headphones "hub" where you turn on/off can be felt like it's dragging, and often makes you readjust the weight of that because it'll shift around.
customer_reviews.author: Justin armstrong

customer_reviews.title: SkullCandy is Phenomenal! 💀👂🏻🎶
customer_reviews.text: I just got my brand new iPhone 11 Pro Max, Space Gray, 512 gigabytes, on Verizon Wireless. & I wanted wireless headphones for a while. So it’s so cool I can watch movies, videos, shows, listen to my music & have my phone charging while I can do that all. I got the Purple, & the crimson ones. 🔻TIP: When about to purchase these, buy 2 of them so they’ll always be charged up when you need to switch them. So the second pair is working all the time too rotating on the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Hillstrom M.

customer_reviews.title: Wireless In-Ear Earbuds at a Very Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I love my Skullcandy Jib Wireless In-Ear Earbuds, even if the battery requires recharging after only four hours of use. The sound quality, however, is excellent, and they are quite comfortable to wear. Most importantly, they are wireless and allow me to walk about having to deal with a cumbersome cord.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Little Caesars of earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: I am a firm believer that most things should be judged by what they are. I am not going to say these are better than Bose or Sony (not by a long shot) because frankly that is a stupid thing to say. But for what they are, the price, and what they say they will deliver on- they're pretty fantastic. I use them at the gym, and breaks at work and they hold up well. And there isn't any concern of destroying them because I really don't care. Yeah battery life is so so, and noise cancellation isn't really a thing for ear buds (no less in this price range). But the price to quality ratio is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Almost apocalypse proof...
customer_reviews.text: My son has used a set of these for a couple years. Surviving a teen that long is impressive... but surviving the washer and dryer 3 separate times and still working... there are no words. I bought this set after the latest washing, thinking there was no way they would still work... but after drying they were back up and running like new. Can skull candy make everything? I would never have to replace my car or cell phone if they made it lol. Anyway, great deal on a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nate S

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with this product. They work perfectly and are so small and light weight, I can pin them to my hair under my beenie (hat). I have small ears and these earbuds fit nicely. No lumps show under my beenie to give my secret away. So I can rock out while I work without getting written up for breaking their "no enjoyment allowed on the job" policy.
customer_reviews.author: prAairhead

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: This set of headphones is very easy to operate and very functional for basic needs, such as video conferencing, conference calls, daily use. I always have issues with the apple headphones but these fit and sound great! I personally prefer these over the Apple Airpods or Beats.
customer_reviews.author: CPARKER

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I use these every day. They have great sound quality and design. They lose one star because after using them for a few months I've found I have to charge them every day. Still, they haven't broken and work properly. Plus there's no fear of losing one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Skullcandy wireless earbuds. They have really great sound and I wanted a pair for home and a pair for work. The battery lasts 6 hours as advertised and the richness of the sound is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t charge properly
customer_reviews.text: Won’t charge properly. I have to keep unplugging and then replugging the charger for it to stay charging. As a result, the battery life is terrible. It won’t automatically pair with my phone. And the piece in the middle of the wire pulls at the whole thing and is very uncomfortable. I’ll be repurchasing the inkd wireless as that is far superior to Thai model
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery Life/ Mediocre Sound
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying cheap Skull Candy headphones for years now and I swear the quality gets worse every time... I intentionally buy the inexpensive lines just for commuting/ exercising/ etc. but this is by far the worst pair yet. The sound quality is fine compared to other similarly-priced products, but the battery life is terrible and the quality of materials is about on par with what they give you on an airplane.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Gray

customer_reviews.title: Not the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: They feel awkward. When you turn your head the cord that sits behind your neck doesn't move with you, and the earphone gets pulled out of your ear. They are on a timer that shuts them off after a certain amount of time from the moment they are turned on. This is not cool when using them to talk to people. Its turns off in the middle of your conversation. Battery life is pretty decent though. Being wireless, I'm surprised they last as long as they do. For the money paid I would maybe look for something else next time.
customer_reviews.author: DPH.714

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: These headphone are great for the price. I couldn't quite give them 5 stars because they don't stay on very well. Because they don't have a hard band like most, more expensive, Bluetooth headphones, they just sort of hang behind your head. When seated or on a bike, this is not a problem because it can rest on your shoulders. However, if you're running or lifting weights they will hang from your ears and very likely fall out after a short time. Great sound and battery life though.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These are not the highest quality, but for the price, they are a good buy. You can hear background noise, which may be good if you want to be aware of your surroundings. The sound is good (not great), but again for the price, they are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis of CA

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a year and don’t use them too often. Maybe 2 times per week. The battery has not seemed to last more than 8 hours. I am always needing to charge it. The left ear bud is not as loud as the right, which I noticed over the last couple weeks. I thought my ears were have a problem, but it’s the headphones. These are okay if you just need a cheap pair. I think it’s worth spending some more money on a pair that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Neeri

customer_reviews.title: this headphones has great quality and connects great but the one I received ...
customer_reviews.text: this headphones has great quality and connects great but the one I received was not charging at all so I had no choice than to dispose of it, I am very disappointed and my money has been wasted, expect a lot better from a brand such as Sullcandy.
customer_reviews.author: hades

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy finally failed me
customer_reviews.text: Husband and I use Skullcandy earbuds only so, we were jazzed to purchase these. The incredible bass sound and siund quality of Skullcandy is what we got with them, however, the audio constantly cuts in and out as if you're receiving notifications or have a low signal. It's extremely frustrating! Not sure if we got a bad pair or what. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: The headset will shutdown on its' own when on calls.
customer_reviews.text: I lost my airpods and needed a replacement headset for music and talking when driving or traveling on public transportation and when going to the gym. I love Skull Candy products but this one not so much. The music quality is basic and the noise cancellation is great but the headset will turn off mid-call with 50% of battery life left. Speaking of battery life, the headset only lasts 2 hours, maybe 3 if you count the downtime between the auto-shutdowns. Lastly, I constantly have to re-pair them to my Bluetooth; at least 3 times a week which is 3 times too many.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a 3rd grader on virtual learning. They were easy to set up and we have not had trouble with staying connected over the Bluetooth signal. These are not the highest sound quality, but they far exceeded my expectations for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible seller
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. I understand that this was bought from a second buyer used, so I don’t mind the messed up packaging BUT....I do have a problem with a disgusting product. The headphones had nasty dried up earwax in it and do not work. Did NOT come with a charger so I’ve used a mini usb that I could find at my house. Have been charging for over 12 hrs and the light is still red. No instructions no nothing. Horrible NEVER BUY from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Olesya Lomako

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I used the earbuds at least 5 times before writing a review. Each use was a different experience. They didn’t come out of my ears as some reviewers complained about - and I wear them running. But the Bluetooth did disconnect two separate times. Kind of a pain to have to stop running and reconnect. I’m really undecided. I feel like going back to my Sanza Fuze MP3 player. Didn’t really have any issues with that. I don’t know if it’s my phone or the earbuds that caused the disconnect. But when I use my wire earbuds and listen to Pandora, I don’t have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: JLE

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. The sound quality is really nice, much better than several other models I tried. The only thing I don't like is the large plastic piece you can see in the middle of the cord. It's fairly heavy and tends to pull the earbuds down and out of your ears, you'll need some kind of clip to attach the cord to your shirt and keep that part from dragging. Still worth it for the sound quality in this price range, though.
customer_reviews.author: Steph575

customer_reviews.title: don't want to buy it again
customer_reviews.text: 1. very very confusing manual, absolute no idea about what the manual is actually talking about, had to refer to other youtube video to learn how to use, a manual has to tell the user how to start, how to use, steps, but nothing is there. 2. blue tooth actually only work within a few feet, about 6 ft or farther then no signal, not even able to keep a social distance with it-_-, what is the meaning of using blue tooth? 3. it can power off automatically by itself without any operation and any message, and the battery is still full, had to switch to a wired phone during an important meeting.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Try a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Used these headphones for about 3 weeks and loved them (while they worked)!! Now, after 3 weeks they don't hold a charge for more than 10 minutes. Skull candy brand has just done waaaay down over the years. Save your money and go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Died within a week
customer_reviews.text: I received these headphones a WEEK ago. Honestly, they were working really well and I was happy with the purchase. Sound quality was really good, the only thing I could complain about was the battery life - it lasted only 2-3 hours before needing to be charged again. And I found that if not charged all the way it was worse (if it was at 20% it would die within 10 min). When I tried charging it one day, the red charging light no longer came on and it no longer charged. I used the charging cable given with the earphones so I'm not sure what happened. They don't last save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Barid Khan

customer_reviews.title: Came in great condtion
customer_reviews.text: The battery life isnt always the best. Sometimes in dies in like 2 hours and other times it seems like it has juice forever. But they are comfortable to wear and eay to use. Have great sound quality and a great buy for anyone looking for good cheep wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: 05 R6 Rider

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It says they have a six hour battery life but I'm lucky to get a three hour use of these headphones without them randomly turning off. Every once in awhile it will say " battery low please charge" but most of the time it just turns off, no heads up or anything. And they are constantly falling off of me. Only time they dont fall off is if I'm listening to music laying down. I almost lost them out side running errands cuz they fell off.
customer_reviews.author: milagros p.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The battery was placed along the backside of the wires. It always pulled and sometimes made the bud fall out. I did buy very good quality used from amazon so I dont know if it's the bud that sounds blown or the fact that it was used. Take it jow you want. They look cool though
customer_reviews.author: Casie Whims

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good, design flawed
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because the plastic piece in the back is off center and pulls the earbud out of my ear. I also think the wires are too short - if they were longer it might not pull the earbud out of my ear. Otherwise the price is right, the sound quality is very good, and it syncs with my phone very well.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: sound is very good. the range on the connection is great
customer_reviews.text: sound is very good. the range on the connection is great. the only thing that i have an issue with is seldom will break the connection and make a high pitch noise through the left ear bud.
customer_reviews.author: Korey

customer_reviews.title: Accidentally washes and THEY STILL WORK WHAT?
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use Bluetooth headphones with decent sound quality. Definitely a good option for the price. The microphone and connectivity controls are easy to use. It’s a bit awkward at first to get used to the control panel hanging from your ears but that doesn’t take long. Husband says the distance in his open floor plan office is outstanding. But why I’m really here, is that we accidentally washed and dried these and they still work. Like all the way through the laundry. And somehow they function fine. I DONT UNDERSTAND THIS MAGIC. BUY THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: The charging port in the middle gets in the way. I feel like these could be designed differently so that piece is removed. They work pretty well for the gym, but I expected them to cancel noise more. The buds themselves fit great in my ear and they’re comfortable, which isn’t always the case with earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good sound! Comfortable fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have grown attached to this brand. SkullCandy is very comfortable to wear (comes with two sizes of ear pieces) and the sound quality is perfect for me. The piece as a whole sits comfortable around my neck and does not bother me while I’m running. I do wish that the charging cable was longer than 2-3 inches, but that does not take away from the 5 stars the product deserves.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Broken Already
customer_reviews.text: I have had these ear buds for approximately one week and the speaker has gone out already. I no longer have the box or I would send them back immediately. This is a horrible product. DO NOT PURCHASE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Freak

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap Bluetooth earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much when I mow or run Tractor ....so much I bought a second pair , battery life not quite long enough for all day of work....the new ones got washed in the washer in my shirt and through the clothes dryer too! 😜😬 but guess what! They still work!,! !! !! 😃👍
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: There were so many mixed reviews. I have no issues with these. They are plenty loud, buds stay in, battery life is acceptable. It does charge pretty quick as well. I'd buy them again, better than my previous ones.
customer_reviews.author: c0nker TM

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again. Only negative is short-ish battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Best set of earbuds I've ever owned. Skullcandy don't disappoint. Good audio quality, especially considering the price. Great fit for someone like me, which is important because I have tiny ears. The only drawback might be battery life, but about 6 hours isn't bad for their size.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Lonardo

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Everytime i turn these on, they need to be paired again. Other than that they're fine. Battery life seems short. It'll say 40% battery remaining and power off 15 minutes later. Sound is good for audiobooks, not sure about for music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Skullcandy!!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased another one to keep at home for cutting grass. My first purchase I use at work, where I listen to podcasts. Great fit. Battery life is about 6-7 hrs depending how many times I pause it. Volumn and clarity is good, and when making or receiving calls, all is very clear!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Good when you're on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Got them because I needed new headphones, and skull candy doesn't disappoint. Sound and bluetooth is great. Great bonus: it reconnects if you walk too far from your device. Battery shows with the price though. Still useful.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.text: Not that there was anything wrong with the earbuds, I just didn't like the way they felt on my neck so I returned them and got a different version.
customer_reviews.author: Kriss

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Amazing Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new headphones - they’re better than beats :) It’s been 1 year and 1 month and they’re starting to break down so it’s time to get a replacement pair - to be fair my husband wears these during his 2 hour long work outs everyday and he sweats profusely so these are the longest lasting headphones we’ve ever found for him
customer_reviews.author: Mr+MrsDimauro

customer_reviews.title: Great for sound. Horrible for voice calls.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is amazing, even though a bit heavy on the base. But not so much like a pair of beats. If you intend to use this for voice calls it's poor. Controls by left ear is good but bulge that sits on your neck is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Battery charge doesn't last!
customer_reviews.text: First they wouldn't pair with my Surface so I had to buy a Bluetooth receiver to get it to work and then the charge doesn't last!! I purchased these to use at my desk at work so I'm not tied to my laptop by a cord. I put it on the charger every night before I leave and then the next day use them. I get a 'battery low' message by 12p - so the charge isn't even lasting 4-hours!! BOOOOO! I've had them less than a month - Not worth the $
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: It works and the sound is not bad. My issues are that it often cuts out even while I'm holding my phone and there's nothing between them. Also anytime I get a phone call I have to disconnect and reconnect or there's simply no sound. Also it LOOKS cheap and feels cheep. Though it hasnt broken yet I feel like it will soon. Not a bad set of headphones but I feel like for $5 more you get MUCH better quality
customer_reviews.author: Sanna

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work with my laptop and phone sometimes have trouble pairing with my watch. I cannot get the microphone to work with Zoom. They're good for the price but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole F

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, the first pair I used literally to death. BEST cheap pair of wireless earbuds around, the quality is great for the price and I've NEVER had connectivity issues with these. Plus they shipped super fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S.

customer_reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 pairs of these headphones and they have all held up very well (until my dog decided to use the first 2 as his chew toy). Out of all the Bluetooth headphones you can buy at this price point, below $20, these are no doubt the best.
customer_reviews.author: djane

customer_reviews.title: The Sound Is Great
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound quality and they fit really nice without that uncomfortable feeling I get from most jibs. The bluetooth seems to have no or VERY little leakage so that you don't miss one note. Never had the battery run out on a listening session yet, ready to stop listening well before hand. If you want a great sound experience without cords or cumbersome headphones then you won't be disappointed with these babies!
customer_reviews.author: DaddyPa 2-4

customer_reviews.title: Super short, not great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed in these. The cord is super short, the battery life not great. They were for Christmas and have already been replaced with another product that I've left a much better review for.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for ASMR
customer_reviews.text: This is great to listen to music away from your phone, go one walks, do the dishes, clean up around the house, all of which I've done and am very happy with. However I was hoping to use this to also listen to ASMR (definitely recommend listening to some) but it's not nearly as loud as my wired earbuds and has slightly, though noticably, less bass then them aswell. Which sucks because I LOVE loud music but it's good for everything else. To summarize: great for most things but not ASMR or blasting music.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Fall out while running
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds worked ok for a little while. My two main issues are 1) When I went running the battery in the back would pull against the earbuds in my ears. I would constantly be attempting to hold them in my ears and hoping they wouldn't fall out. 2) About 6 months into owning the earbuds I would be listening to music and then the music would cut out and a loud whizzing noise would start. The only way for me to stop the noise was to turn the earbuds off and turn them back on again. I was disappointed considering how much I like some of Skull Candy's other products.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Wegman

product_meta.title: Skullcandy Jib Wireless In-Ear Earbud - Purple
product_meta.description: Color:PurpleDiscover the convenience of Bluetooth listening with Jib wireless. Packing up to 6 rechargeable hours of battery life and an in-line microphone and remote with call and track control, you can live wirelessly without sacrificing any essential features. Impedance: 16 Ohms, Sound Pressure Level: 98+/-3dB at 1KHz and Frequency Response: 20kHz - 20Hz.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars3,978 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
